The biggest risk is not taking any risk... In a world that is changing really quickly, the only strategy that is guaranteed to fail is not taking risks.
There are risks and costs to action. But they are far less than the long range risks of comfortable inaction.
If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.
Take chances, make mistakes. That's how you grow. Pain nourishes your courage. You have to fail in order to practice being brave.
The risk of a wrong decision is preferable to the terror of indecision.
Our lives improve only when we take chances - and the first and most difficult risk we can take is to be honest with ourselves.
Buy the ticket, take the ride.
It's true hard work never killed anybody, but I figure, why take the chance?

I haven't lived a perfect life. I have regrets. But that's from a lifetime of taking chances, making decisions, and trying not to be frozen. The only thing that I can do with my regrets is understand them.
You have to take risks. We will only understand the miracle of life fully when we allow the unexpected to happen.
Just keep taking chances and having fun.
It seems to be a law of nature, inflexible and inexorable, that those who will not risk cannot win.
When it comes to luck, you make your own.
If you take no risks, you will suffer no defeats. But if you take no risks, you win no victories.
I postpone death by living, by suffering, by error, by risking, by giving, by losing.
I think we consider too much the good luck of the early bird and not enough the bad luck of the early worm.
Necessity is the mother of taking chances.
Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes farthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare.
If you're so afraid of failure, you will never succeed. You have to take chances.
Your chances of success in any undertaking can always be measured by your belief in yourself.

Luck always favours the brave. And you must remember that brave are the people who follow their heart; brave are the people who take chances in life. Which also means you have to say no sometimes. I believe the power of no is greater than yes.
Don't ever try and be like anybody else and don't be afraid to take risks.
Take calculated risks. That is quite different from being rash.
We are not trying to entertain the critics. I'll take my chances with the public.
Living at risk is jumping off the cliff and building your wings on the way down.
Often the difference between a successful man and a failure is not one's better abilities or ideas, but the courage that one has to bet on his ideas, to take a calculated risk, and to act.
The chances of each of us coming into existence are infinitesimally small, and even though we shall all die some day, we should count ourselves fantastically lucky to get our decades in the sun.
The right time is any time that one is still so lucky as to have.

The best thing to do is stare it in the face and move on. We have to face our fears and plow through. I think taking chances takes a lot more courage than staying stagnant and doing what's safe and comfortable.
I believe in taking chances and living your life. Sometimes doors open and others close and you have to figure out which one you're going to take. I'm always for the one that's challenging.

I must learn to love the fool in me - the one who feels too much, talks too much, takes too many chances, wins sometimes and loses often, lacks self-control, loves and hates, hurts and gets hurt, promises and breaks promises, laughs and cries.
I think the harder you work, the more luck you have.
I've always taken risks, and never worried what the world might really think of me.
Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.
Most of us regard good luck as our right, and bad luck as a betrayal of that right.
I prefer to be alive, so I'm cautious about taking risks.
Take risks. Ask big questions. Don't be afraid to make mistakes; if you don't make mistakes, you're not reaching far enough.
If no one ever took risks, Michaelangelo would have painted the Sistine floor.
Some folk want their luck buttered.
I fear the boredom that comes with not learning and not taking chances.

One hour of life, crowded to the full with glorious action, and filled with noble risks, is worth whole years of those mean observances of paltry decorum, in which men steal through existence, like sluggish waters through a marsh, without either honor or observation.
A pound of pluck is worth a ton of luck.
Good luck is a residue of preparation.
Luck marches with those who give their very best.
Luck, that's when preparation and opportunity meet.
You don't concentrate on risks. You concentrate on results. No risk is too great to prevent the necessary job from getting done.
The worst cynicism: a belief in luck.
If your parents never had children, chances are you won't either.
Anytime we step out boldly to make changes, we take a chance that we might fail. But the only way to get better is to try.
Determination, energy, and courage appear spontaneously when we care deeply about something. We take risks that are unimaginable in any other context.
Even when you have doubts, take that step. Take chances. Mistakes are never a failure - they can be turned into wisdom.
Every business and every product has risks. You can't get around it.

If you are living a life that feels right to you, if you're willing to take creative chances or a creative path that feels like it's mostly in keeping with your sensibilities, you know, aesthetic and artistic, then that's what matters.
I'm the one who will take chances, not worry about the backlash.
I believe in luck: how else can you explain the success of those you dislike?
I don't believe in pitfalls. I believe in taking risks and not doing the same thing twice.
The only safe thing is to take a chance.
It's not that I don't value my life. It's just that I love taking chances, testing myself, stepping over the line.
Beware of missing chances; otherwise it may be altogether too late some day.
